value: Shell Cartouches and Acanthus Leaf Motif

label: Description
value: Large shell motifs decorated with bandwork. Acanthus leaves, floral garlands, and small leafy sprays intertwine with the shells.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Winged Griffin on a Rocaille Bracket, Plate 6, Première Partie divers Ornements (Various Ornament Designs, Part One)

label: Description
value: Large scale design with fantastical winged dragon diabolically encircling on acanthus leaf, his tongue extending from an open mouth, the tail intertwining a leafy branch. The dragon is perched on a rococo bracket, which is decorated with raffle leaves and small repetitive motifs.

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Seconde Partie De Divers Ornements par Peyrotte

label: Description
value: Arrangement of acanthus leaves, twigs, branches, and berries to frame a compartment resembling a painter's palette. A bundle of eight long paintbrushes extend from lower center to upper right.

Desseins de Tiroir et entrée de Serrure

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Design for an elaborate Cabriolet in the Rococo manner.  Cabriolet is covered with floral ornament with two masks carved into it.  At the front, beneath the driver's seat, on sees what is either a tray or mirror.  Behind the passenger's seat, there is space for storage.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Design for a carriage.  The roof of the coach is dome-shaped with tassels hanging down.  Plant ornament encompasses the coach from its door to its wheels.  At the back of the coach, where the driver would presumably sit, a crown and possibly a riding crop are set upon a cushion.  At the front of the coach, there are various household objects like a lamp and ornate, framed mirror.  The carriage's door has a screen-like window, and below this, a framed pastoral scene.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for Interior Decoration of Doorway

label: Description
value: Interior doors, walls, benches; on walls, pastoral scenes with figures, hanging vines and leaves, trees. Over door, fruits, vegetables, and fowl; all decorated with C-curves and putti.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on white laid paper tipped into cream laid paper

Design for Interior Wall Decoration with Chair

label: Description
value: Interior with throne-like chair at center. Portrait on back of chair framed by halo with flowers and sunrays; chair shaped with leaves, flanked by large escutcheons heavily decorated with plumed helmets, axes, bows and arrows, flags, musical instruments, and putti. Above chair, canopy with draping lines and foliage. All interior framed with curved molding, scenes with putti, and candles.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on white laid paper tipped into cream laid paper

label: Dimensions
value: Sheet: 40.6 x 64.1 cm (16 in. x 25 1/4 in.) Platemark: 40.6 x 33.3 cm (16 in. x 13 1/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Interior showing clock, benches with legs made of wooden pieces placed in diagonal formation with leaves; back of benches decorated with fish scales and framed by curves and fantastic plants. Centerpiece clock in rounded niche with nude figures perched on top, woman with vegetal headdress, draping foliage; sides, two niches with infants and draping plants and fountains.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on white laid paper tipped into cream laid paper

label: Dimensions
value: Sheet: 40.6 x 64.1 cm (16 in. x 25 1/4 in.) Platemark: 40.6 x 58.8 cm (16 in. x 23 1/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: At the top center of drawing, below a cove, is a bag of arrows resting on a bed of feathers.  Beneath this canopy of feathers, there is a fruit tree and sitting below the tree on a platform are a platform are a man and woman playing music as a child peers at them.  On either side of this scene, there is a tree with a child below it on a platform.  One child is poking its finger through a birdcage, while the other is holding a horn or some kind of toy.  The space is surrounded by Rocaille architecture and ornament.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on white laid paper
